Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Kun tu bzang po/Kun tu bzang mo
Description_English: Samantabhadra, or the Primordial Buddha in the Great Perfection tradition, existing prior to concepts of space, time, self or other. In the mind-to-mind transmission by victorious ones, the primary teacher is the union of Samantabhadra and Samantabhadrī. Radiates in the state of the natural Great Perfection without straying from the ground of awareness. Samantabhadrī is the feminine form of the primordial Buddha in the Great Perfection tradition, existing prior to concepts of space, time, self or other. Together with Samantabhadra forms the primary teacher in mind-to-mind transmission by victorious ones.

From the appearing aspect of the ground of awareness's luminous nature, the Buddhas of the five families surrounded by their maṇḍalas spontaneously arise. This marks the beginning of the saṃbhogakāya transmission of the mind-to-mind transmission by victorious ones.
Gave_Teachings_To: Supreme Emanation Blessing; Sublime Wisdom Emanation (Vajradhara)

Description_English: A supreme emanation that manifests from the Buddhas of the Five Families, representing the blessing aspect of primordial wisdom transmission.
Gave_Teachings_To: Vajrasattva; Vajrapāṇi; Cheu Nangwa Dampa Samkyi Mikhyapa

Description_English: Self-arising nirmāṇakāya emanation that spontaneously appears atop a lotus as the perfect saṃbhogakāya during the first eon called 'eon of abundant delight.' Through his own realization, teaches the natural, ineffable Great Perfection to Vajrasattva and Vajrapāṇi.
Gave_Teachings_To: Vajrasattva; Vajrapāṇi; Cheu Nangwa Dampa Samkyi Mikhyapa

Description_English: A saṃbhogakāya Buddha who receives the Dzogchen teachings from Sublime Wisdom Emanation (Vajradhara) through mind-to-mind transmission. In the Padmasambhava transmission, receives the Eighteen Tantras from Sublime Wisdom Emanation (Vajradhara), while in the Heart Essence of Vimalamitra lineage, receives only the Seventeen Tantras.

A saṃbhogakāya Buddha, sometimes known as the wrathful form of Vajrasattva. Receives the Dzogchen teachings from Sublime Wisdom Emanation (Vajradhara) through mind-to-mind transmission. Like Vajrasattva, receives varying numbers of tantras depending on the transmission lineage.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Khye'u snang ba dam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa
Description_English: First of twelve Dzogchen teachers, who is a nirmāṇakāya emanation of Sublime Wisdom Emanation (Vajradhara). Located at Ganden Tsekpa. Part of the final section of the mind-to-mind transmission.

The historical Buddha who lived as a wandering ascetic in South Asia 2500 years ago and attained enlightenment under the bodhi tree. His given name was Siddhartha and his clan name was Gautama. In Dzogchen history, received teachings from Cheu Nangwa Dampa Samkyi Mikhyapa.

Considered an emanation of Vajrapāṇi, born in the region of Dhanakosha in Oḍḍiyana. The 6,400,000 verses of Dzogchen tantras and the three series were primordially present in his mind. Vajrapāṇi appeared to him and granted permission to commit the tantras to writing.

Born in a brahmin family west of Bodh Gaya. Met Garab Dorjé at the charnel ground of Shitavana and remained there for 75 years mastering all teachings. Responsible for dividing the Dzogchen tantras into three categories: Mind, Space, and Pith Instruction Series.

Born in Chinese city Shocham Nakpo. Met Mañjushrimitra at Sosadvipa charnel ground. Divided the most sublime secret texts into four cycles: outer, inner, secret, and most secret unsurpassable. Achieved the luminous body and taught dharma to mamos and ḍākinīs.

Born in city of Kamaru in eastern India, contemporary with Vimalamitra. Received the most unsurpassable secret cycle from Śrī Siṃha. Retrieved texts concealed by Śrī Siṃha and went to live in the charnel ground called Bhasing in India.

Born in city of Langpo Gang in Western India, contemporary with Jñānasūtra. Received complete outer, inner, and secret cycles from Śrī Simha, and later the most unsurpassable secret cycle from Jñānasūtra. Taught five people including King Trisong Detsen and proceeded to Wu Tai Shan in China.
Gave_Teachings_To: King Trisong Detsen; Nyang Tingzin Zanpo

Description_English: 38th King of Tibet, one of the three dharma kings. Invited Shantarakshita and Padmasambhava to Tibet. Received transmissions from both Padmasambhava and Vimalamitra. Had five wives including Yeshe Tsogyel, and daughter Princess Pemasel.

Convinced King Trisong Detsen to invite Vimalamitra to Tibet. Received full transmission from Vimalamitra, then left for China and practiced for 55 years. Hid teachings in Zha Templa with protective seals making them invisible.

Born into the Bé clan in Pen Valley, central Tibet. Studied all pith instructions from Nyang Tingzin Zangpo. Practiced at different holy sites and achieved an immutable form of rainbow body that leaves behind no physical residue.
Born into the Drom clan in central Tibet. Received the oral lineage of the Heart Essence teachings from Bé Lodrö Wangchuk. Practiced at a cliff known as Drakar Tso and other places.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Ldang ma Lhun grub rgyal mtshan
Description_English: Received complete transmission of oral lineage from Drom Rinchen Bar. Received prophecy from deity Vajrasadhu and revealed manuscripts previously hidden by Nyang Tingzin Zangpo 100 years earlier in the temple of Zha.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Lce btsun Seng ge dbang phyug
Description_English: Received all instructions from Dangma Lhundrup Gyaltsen. Copied and re-concealed Treasure manuscripts near Takdra Spring in three places. Had visions of Vimalamitra who gave him complete Heart Essence empowerments and transmissions.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Zhang ston Bkra shis rdo rje
Description_English: Born in Lado in the region of Yardok Donang. At age 21 in 1117, revealed Treasures buried by Chetsun Wangchuk. In 1121 at age 25, met Chetsun Sengge Wangchuk and received complete transmission of Dzogchen Heart Essence teachings.

Son of Zhangton Tashi Dorje, born in 1158. Considered an emanation of Vajrapāṇi according to prophecy in the Tantra Beyond Sound. Received Heart Essence of Vimalamitra from his father and composed the commentary Eleven Words and Meanings.
Possible nephew to Nyima Bum. Received the whole Heart Essence transmission from Nyima Bum.

Born in town of Soge Treng in Yoru region of Tibet. Had numerous pure visions and received vision of Avalokiteśvara at age 13 telling him to practice Dzogchen Heart Essence. Received full teachings from Guru Jober.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Sgrub chen Me long mdo rje
Description_English: Born in upper part of Drak Valley. Studied with many teachers and received Dzogchen Heart Essence from Trulshik Senggé Gyabpa. Traveled to hidden lands and revealed Treasure from Drak Yongdzong known as Melong Heart Essence.

Born in town Barsar Dzinkha in Yoru region. Met Melong Dorje who introduced him to the nature of mind. Served as Melong Dorje's attendant in Bhutan and had vision of Padmasambhava. Transmitted teachings to disciples Longchenpa and Karmapa Rangjung Dorje.
Gave_Teachings_To: Longchenpa Drime Özer; Karmapa Rangjung Dorje

Description_English: Born in Todtrong village in Upper Dra valley in Yoru. Met Rigzin Kumārarāja around age 25 and received Heart Essence teachings. Claimed to have had visions of ḍākinīs authenticating his identity as reincarnation of Pema Ledrelstel and Princess Pemasel.

Received Mind, Space, and Pith Instruction Series from Śrī Siṃha along with the Seventeen Tantras and eighteenth Tantra of the Sun. Received Padmasambhava empowerments and practiced for three years attaining vajra body. Transmitted eighteen tantras to Yeshe Tsogyel and Heart Essence to Princess Pemasel.
Gave_Teachings_To: Yeshe Tsogyel; Princess Lhacam Pema Sel; King Trisong Detsen

Description_English: Born in Chog ro Dringtsam with auspicious mark of double vajra on forehead. Offered to Padmasambhava by King Trisong Detsen. Received profound pith instructions from Padmasambhava and helped commit them to writing. Responsible for burying Padmasambhava's many Treasures.
Literally 'sky-goers' from Sanskrit root ḍī meaning to fly. Non-human feminine entities that are protectors and keepers of the Dzogchen teachings, especially important in the Padmasambhava.

Daughter of King Trisong Detsen who died at age 8 due to karmic obstacles. Revived by Padmasambhava who gave her secret name Pema Ledreltsel and transmitted Padmasambhavas to her. Prophesied to re-reveal this Treasure in future life.

Reincarnation of Princess Pema Sel, reborn in Dritang. At age 23 in 1313, revealed Treasures of Padmasambhava from Danglung Tramo boulder in Dagspo. Met with inauspicious circumstances and died young.

Primary disciple of Tsultrim Dorje/Pema Ledreltsel. Born with prophesied mole on right thigh. After receiving Heart Essence transmission, practiced diligently for twelve years. Transmitted teachings to Rinchen Lingpa, Jadralwa Zöpa, and Karmapa Rangjung Dorje.
Gave_Teachings_To: Meban Rinchen Lingpa; Jadralwa Zöpa; Karmapa Rangjung Dorje

Description_English: Third Karmapa, head of Karma Kagyü school. Born in Tsa Pugang Zhurmo. Student of Rigzin Kumararājā for Heart Essence of Vimalamitra. Received Padmasambhavas from either Tulku Lekden or Lotön Dorje Bum. Transmitted teachings to Longchenpa and Gyalwa Yungtön Dorje Pel.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: rGyal ba g.yung ston rdo rje dpal
Description_English: Born into Len clan in Tsongdu. Studied with many teachers including Butön Rinchen Drub and Third Karmapa. Received Mahāmudrā teachings and Padmasambhava transmission from Karmapa. Author of early transmission history of Padmasambhava.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Me ban Rin chen gling pa
Description_English: Born in Tsedrong in Loro Karpo. Treasure revealer who gave Pema Ledreltsel the prophetic guide leading to Padmasambhava. After Pema Ledreltsel revealed the Treasure, received transmission from Gyalse Legpa. Likely main teacher of Rigzin Gödemchen.

Born in Nyenyul. In 1366 unearthed first of Northern Treasures in form of seven paper scrolls and four volumes of Samantabhadra's Unimpeded Realization. His Treasure includes 40-60% of original core of Padmasambhava. Credited with unearthing keys to hidden lands.
Received_Teachings_From: Meban Rinchen Lingpa; Longchenpa Drime Özer (via visions)

Description_English: Born in place called Gong. Author of main transmission histories of Padmasambhava. Received transmissions from Longchenpa, Rinchen Lingpa, and three separate transmissions from Tulku Legden.
Received_Teachings_From: Longchenpa Drime Özer; Meban Rinchen Lingpa; Tulku Legden/Gyalse Legpa

Description_English: Born in region of Nyemo Jekar. Following King Trisong Detsen's orders, underwent 507 hardships to reach India and meet Śrī Siṃha. Received empowerments and pith instructions of sixty classes of tantra. Met Garab Dorje and received 6,400,000 verses of Dzogchen tantras.
Also known as Pang Mipam Gönpo. Only encountered dharma when very elderly, over age 85. Practiced according to oral transmissions of Vairocana, attaining siddhis and living to over 100 years old.

Name_Wylie_Tibetan: Ngen lam Byang chub rgyal mtshan
Description_English: Also known as Ralsumpa of Ngenlam in Uru region. Received instructions from Pang Mipam Gönpo and meditated on cliff known as Wa Senggé Drak. Reached 172 years and passed away without leaving physical remains.
Student of Ngenlam from eastern Tibet. After receiving instructions, stayed at same cliff as his guru. Reached age 144 and passed away without leaving physical remains.

From Chongye in Yarlung valley. Received instructions from Zadam Rinchenyik and meditated at Wa Sengge Drak until age 117, passing away without physical remains. Transmitted teachings to multiple disciples including Yudra Nyingpo.
One of twenty-five disciples of Padmasambhava and main disciple of Vairocana. Received Heart Essence teachings from Vairocana.
Received Heart Essence teachings from Yudra Nyingpo.
Received Heart Essence teachings from Aro Yeshe Jungne.
Received Heart Essence teachings from Setsün.

Born in Belmo, Kham. Received many teachings including Dzogchen Heart Essence from Jangtön Namdak. Founded famous Katok Monastery in 1159. Authored important commentaries to the Gathering of All Intentions Sūtra.
Students of Khugyur Salwaichok in the Vairocana lineage.
